data.title: Smith College vs. Brown 2024
data.meta_description: What’s the better school? This is an important decision…. so we created a full of between dorms, social life, costs and more between Smith College and Brown. Which will you go to?
data.text:
Differences between Smith College and Brown University

Before we get into the nitty-gritty, let’s go through a general overview of the high-level differences between Smith College and Brown University . The table below summarizes some of the most important statistics around competitiveness, costs, etc.

Smith College Brown University In-state Tuition $46,288 $49,346 Net Price $27,880 $27,496 Average Financial Aid $38,324 $40,817 Total Undergraduates 2471 6320 Average SAT Scores 0 - 0 1370 - 1560 Acceptance Rate 38 9 Location Elm St One Prospect Street City Name Northampton Providence

WARNINGS: Based on net price alone, Brown University is the cheaper option. However, this sticker price may not adequately represent the difference in living costs between Northampton and Providence. Smith College is in a New England and Brown is in a New England - sometimes off campus meals and housing costs can dramatically vary between schools

Is Smith College or Brown University Harder to get into? Which school is easier to get into?

If you’re looking at acceptance rate alone, then Brown University is more difficult to get into. However, each college is looking to fill its incoming class with a variety of students with different strengths, backgrounds, etc.

Therefore, the acceptance rate alone is not a good indicator that Brown University is a better school or will be more difficult for you specifically to get into. On the flipside, Smith College is easier to get into based on acceptance rate alone.

You can use the below college admissions predictor to determine your likelihood of acceptance at either school.

Which is better: Smith College or Brown University ?

We’ve compared dorm life, costs, outcomes and more to provide the most complete comparison between Smith College and Brown. But, you’re smart enough to know that numbers paint a terrible picture for truly understanding what each college and community is like. And, the real answer to which school is better is: the school that’s right for you. No matter who you ask, if they know what they’re talking about, the answer is the same: the “better” school is whatever is the best fit for you personally. That’s why it’s extremely important to check out all the videos on CampusReel for each school.
